results.title: The New order
results.creator_credit: Christine Olsen, Curtis Levy, Zex AFFC and Olsen Levy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Riding the tiger”.
Riding the Tiger Series. In this episode we trace the struggle between the military, the communists and the rich landed Muslim gentry to control the economy of the newly-formed nation. In 1965 the tensions between the various factions exploded: President Sukarno was replaced by military general Suharto and half a million communists and “communist sympathisers” were executed. Since 1965 the military has developed a one-party dictatorship which actively encourages its civilians to allow the dictates of business (both local and foreign) to take precedence over all other aspects of life. The last part of the video examines the conflict between Indonesia’s economic growth and its governments’ consistent human rights abuses.

results.title: The New morality
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, Richard Schickel and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Life goes to the movies”.
Hosted by Henry Fonda, Shirley MacLaine and Liza Minnelli. Takes a look at the life and career of Marilyn Monroe as well as the movies of the sixties. Their language, sexuality and violence portraying a new morality unthinkable a deecade earlier. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The New mine
results.brief_description: A study of a modern colliery at Comrie, in Scotland. Comrie is a challenge to coalmine owners. It has been fully mechanised with the most modern coal-hewing and safety equipment; ventilation throughout the mine is constant and controlled, and every amenity and safety measure to help the men who work underground is in use. In addition, the surface works are well planned, so that slagheaps and railway-yards do not deface the countryside.

results.title: The New materials frontier
results.brief_description: Prospects for the development of new materials are almost limitless as scientists understand how the properties of materials relate to their internal structures, and can thus design materials to meet specific requirements. This program outlines the classification of materials into categories of metals, ceramics, polymers and composites. The general properties of each, as related to their different atomic or molecular bonding is also discussed. The way their atoms or electrons are arranged and the subsequent characteristics of each type of material is also covered.

results.title: The New librarians
results.creator_credit: Henri Bagdadi, Universal Education and Visual Arts and Michael Bloebaum
results.brief_description: A panoramic view of the exciting changes occurring in schools, public and business libraries. Shows the importance of a library to the population it serves. The new librarians are reaching out to the public via mobile units, jazz sessions, video tape, computers, etc

results.title: The New Italian
results.creator_credit: Intertel, Westinghouse Broadcasting, National Educational Television, Michael Alexander and Joseph Krumgold
results.brief_description: Using the small village of Gerrandina in the south as an example, this is a survey of the Italian government’s attempt to deal with Italy’s surplus population. Formerly this problem had been solved by immigration, but now land reform and more industrialisation are bringing more work and better living conditions to the southern Italian peasant

results.title: The New healers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
Over a quarter of a million Australians now use the services of alternative healers, a sign, perhaps, of a new understanding of the holistic nature of health care where the patient can do much to achieve good health. In this episode, presenter Nevill Drury interviews a chiropractor; naturopath, Dorothy Hall, who explains iridology and how it can be used to diagnose illness; Melbourne surgeon, Avri Sali, who explains how dietary change can prevent gallstones and bowel disease; and participants at Hopewood Health Centre and Euroa House who use relaxation techniques, healthy diet and rebirthing to improve their lives.
